alert.note: Alert for Northern Warren; Northern Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 1:59PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Warren and west central Washington Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 158 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Warrensburg, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Warrensburg, Bolton Landing, Bolton, Shelving Rock, Cleverdale, Riverbank, Rockhurst, North Bolton, Pilot Knob, Darrowsville and Diamond Point. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
